sen.j: 大江駅（おおええき）は、京都府福知山市大江町 (京都府)河守（こうもり）にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道（KTR）北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Oe Station is a railroad station on the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR) Miyafuku Line located in Oe-cho of Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Oe Station, a railroad station on the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR) Miyafuku Line, is located in Oe-cho of Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Oe Station, located in Oe-cho of Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railroad station on the Miyafuku Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).

sen.j: 起終点を除くと、線内で唯一、全ての列車が停車する。
sen.e: Except for the terminal stations, this is the only station where all trains on this line stop.
Except for the terminal stations, it's the only station at which all trains on the line stop.
Except for the terminal stations, it's the only station at which all trains on the line stop.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Structure of the station
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 島式1面2線のプラットホームを持つ高架駅で、鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Oe Station is an elevated station that has an island platform with a railroad track running on each side.
Oe Station is an elevated facility with an island platform serving two tracks, one on each side.
Oe Station is an elevated facility with an island platform serving two tracks, one on each side.

sen.j: ホーム上に待合室を持つ。
sen.e: There is a waiting room on the platform.
The platform is equipped with a waiting room.
The platform is equipped with a waiting room.

sen.j: 1996年3月16日の鉄道の電化を機に一線スルー化とプラットホームの延伸工事が施工される。
sen.e: As a result of the electrification of railroads on March 16, 1996, construction work was started to make a separate railroad track for trains that pass the station without stopping and to expand the platform.

Consequent upon the electrification of railroads on March 16, 1996, construction work was implemented to make a separate railroad track for trains that pass the station without stopping, as well as to expand the platform.

Consequent upon the electrification of railroads on March 16, 1996, construction work was implemented to make a separate railroad track for trains that pass the station without stopping, as well as to expand the platform.

sen.j: 駅構内には、大江観光株式会社が運営する売店が設けられており、鬼饅頭などの特産品が販売されている。
sen.e: There is a store operated by Oe Tourism Company inside the station building, where local products such as Oni Manju (bean-jam rice buns) are sold.
The station building contains a store operated by the Oe Tourism Company, where local products such as Oni Manju (bean-jam rice buns) are sold.
The station building contains a store operated by the Oe Tourism Company, where local products such as Oni Manju (bean-jam rice buns) are sold.

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Areas around the station
Areas around the station
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 大江山の鬼伝説に因み、駅前には鬼の像や鬼瓦、モザイク画などが並ぶ。
sen.e: Ogre statues, gargoyles, mosaics of ogres are displayed in front of the station after the legend of ogres of Mt. Oe.
Ogre statues, gargoyles and mosaics of ogres are displayed in front of the station, based on the legendary ogres of Mt. Oe.
Ogre statues, gargoyles and mosaics of ogres are displayed in front of the station, based on the legendary ogres of Mt. Oe.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約112人である。
sen.e: The number of daily passengers using the station was about 112 in 2006.
The average daily number of passengers who used the station in 2006 was 112.

sen.j: 大江町 (京都府)地区の中心にある。
sen.e: Oe Station is located at the center of Oe-cho (Kyoto Prefecture).
Oe Station is located at the center of Oe-cho, in Kyoto Prefecture.
Oe Station is located at the center of Oe-cho (Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 宮福線では、4番目に利用者が多い。
sen.e: It has the fourth largest number of passengers among the stations on the Miyafuku Line.
It has the fourth-largest number of passengers among the stations on the Miyafuku Line.
It has the fourth-largest number of passengers among the stations on the Miyafuku Line.

History

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）7月16日 - 宮福鉄道（現・北近畿タンゴ鉄道）宮福線の駅として開業。
sen.e: Oe station opened as a Miyafuku Railway (currently, the Kitakinki Tango Railway) Miyafuku Line station.
sen.cmt: 英文（日付）が入力できません。
sen.e: Oe station opened as a facility on the Miyafuku Line of the Miyafuku Railway (currently the Kitakinki Tango Railway).
July 16, 1988: Oe station opened as a facility on the Miyafuku Line of the Miyafuku Railway (currently the Kitakinki Tango Railway).

sen.j: 駅前から100mほど西寄りに、かつて北丹鉄道の終点・河守駅があった。
sen.e: There used be Kawamori Station, a Hokutan Railway terminal station, about 100 meters to the west of the station.
Kawamori Station, a Hokutan Railway terminal station, was once located approximately 100 meters west of this facility.
Kawamori Station, a Hokutan Railway terminal station, was once located approximately 100 meters west of this facility.
